title: 110_hr4105
content: The Act titled "Medicare Recovery Audit Contractor Program Moratorium Act of 2007" imposes a moratorium on the Medicare Recovery Audit Contractor Program. The "Medicare Recovery Audit Contractor Program Moratorium Act of 2007" suspends all activities under the program, prohibits identifying underpayments or overpayments, and stops new contracts. The moratorium ends one year after enactment, with exceptions for appeal rights and Medicare secondary payer activities. The "Medicare Recovery Audit Contractor Program Moratorium Act of 2007" suspends program activities, prohibits identifying underpayments or overpayments, and stops new contracts. Medicare secondary payer activities are not affected by the moratorium. A report evaluating the program must be submitted to Congress within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The curr_chunk discusses the activities of recovery audit contractors, including the number of claims requested, reviewed, and recouped for overpayments. It also mentions the appeals made by providers and suppliers in response to these audits. The curr_chunk discusses reporting requirements for activities under the Medicare recovery audit contractor program, including appeals made by providers and suppliers. The information is reported on a national, State, and county basis, as well as by provider group and appeal level. The curr_chunk discusses the GAO report on the use of recovery audit contractors in the Medicare Integrity program, including their role in the oversight process and a comparison of their roles. The curr_chunk discusses the comparison of recovery audit contractors with quality improvement organizations and Medicare administrative contractors, as well as an examination of their consistency with Medicare policy on claims denials and appeals. Recommendations are included to improve accuracy and compliance. The curr_chunk discusses quarterly reports on the Medicare recovery audit contractor program submitted to Congress, detailing information for each calendar quarter after the moratorium. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the Medicare recovery audit contractor program, including Medicare administrative contractor and Medicare secondary payer activities. The curr_chunk defines terms like provider, quality improvement organization, recovery audit contractor, and supplier in relation to Medicare secondary payer activities. The curr_chunk provides amendments to the Social Security Act and the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003 related to the Medicare Recovery Audit Contractor Program Moratorium Act of 2007. The Secretary will conduct amendments to the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003.
